name: Roaring Brook Ranch & Tennis Resort

reviews.title: May have been the thing to do in the 40's or 50's...not today.
reviews.text: The room was disappointing at $240. It had the smell of an old hotel. The sink in our unit sputtered everytime it was used (the hotel was not full while in the height of tourist season...a bad indication) probably because it wasn't used in quite some time. Tennis courts were bumpy (okay for duffers) which was disappointing in a place that uses "tennis" in its name. Breakfast and suppers were included. The menu was limited, and of poor quality (agian please reference the $240 price tag). There were two pool tables...had to pay to use them. In the end...threw away the money and left...couldn't spend the night.

reviews.title: Pretty place and friendly staff
reviews.text: Fall colors hadn't quite started yet, but the view was lovely and their friendly staff always tried to please us. We had stayed here 5 years earlier and looked forward to returning to see the staff and the place itself.

reviews.title: Ohhh no, Ewww!
reviews.text: Room was clean and waking up in the morning with the smell the fresh Adirondack air made a good start to each day.

reviews.title: hated it
reviews.text: The horse riding was pleasant but just hanging around the place is always fun. We will return again.

reviews.title: Loved the Brook!!!!
reviews.text: Nice place to visit for a day, maybe.

Stayed Aug 3 to 5. Very clean,large complex. Great pool. We had rooms right by the pool. Came with a group of 8 rooms of all ages. Everyone thought that the rooms were very nice. The food was Great. I did not see all the other rooms at the ranch but ours could not be better. I cannot beleive all the other bad reviews. We will be back next year.
reviews.title: Great for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here a couple of times and always had a great time. This time there was many problems on the trail rides. There is a young wrangler who is only 16 years old and is very inexperienced. The father who runs the barn is letting him take out rides on his own and he can barely ride himself. We have never run into this before this year. This place has always had great experienced wranglers until this year. Be aware if you are sent on a ride alone with this wrangler as he has a very hard time controlling his own horse and due to his inability to ride has sent the other horses into a tailspin and it is not safe for inexperienced riders to be out alone with him. On our ride he almost fell off and upset all the horses behind him. Insist on one of the more experienced riders, Teddy , Cassidy or Jason be with your ride.
reviews.title: HORSEBACK RIDING !!

likes.disliked: — Feeling unsafe on the trail rides for the first time

reviews.text: Wranglers are suppose to be 18 in New York and this wrangler has stated he is only 16 to the whole trail ride, but, that the office staff has been told he is 18 and he thought
reviews.title: Roaring Brook Ranch - Stuck in the 80s

reviews.text: We are hoping that Roaring brook will correct this situation as we believe they will lose a lot of business if they continue to make the guests fell unsafe on the trails with this child.
reviews.title: Not at all worth the price...needs renovating!
Would definitely go back !
reviews.text: We always have loved coming here because of the great trail rides that Teddy has provided, but, we will not return until this situation is taken care of. We hope the management will remedy this situation quickly before someone gets hurt on the trails. The food is wonderful and staff is great and you can’t beat the location.

aka: Roaring Brook Ranch And Tennis Resort
